ygData.msgSnippet: The bot side of him wanted to follow her, to push the issue. She He wouldn t have to had think about it if someone asked him that question. I m a survivor, he

The bot side of him wanted to follow her, to push the issue. She He 
wouldn't have to had think about it if someone asked him that 
question.

"I'm a survivor,"he thought to himself as Shadow Wing moved away, He 
knew most of his past now. He still wanted to know more.Lunarpine 
understood himself, even though he wasn't complete, "I'm a survivor, 
a hunter, a killer." Searching through his datatracks he 
realized, "Add arogance and I'd be a Predicon."

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> This was  one question that she hadn't even asked herself yet.  She 
> took a moment to comtemplate this question.  She searched her spark 
> and found the answer.  "I am a Recon bot. I follow my spark as well 
> as orders. No, I don't think I'm a leader. At least I have had no 
> cchance to lead yet." She looked at him for a moment.  She knew 
that 
> in order to accomplish any type of training or gain in skills, she 
> would have to put her feeling for him aside. She thought that being 
a 
> ffighter was out of the question right now.  She knew that he was 
> right about one thing, she would have to find herself before 
anything 
> else could happen for her.  "I will return after a few hours."  
> She started to walk to the entrance of the base.  She stopped and 
> turned around. She looked at Lunarpine. "And I will return this 
> time." She smiled and walked out.  She transformed into her
>  owl mode and flew off.
> 
> She went to a small grove near the base.  She sat and meditated on 
> the words that Lunarpine had used. "Fighter? No, that I am not. 
> Lover? That one will have to wait. Follower? Yes, that I am. I do 
> follow my commanders. Leader? No, that I am not."  She went through 
> her systems and programming.  She downloaded a Scout program that 
she 
> didn't realize that she had.  She gained a little more confidence 
in 
> herself.  She realized that all bots must work within the means 
that 
> they have.  She stayed perched in the tree and wathced the sun 
set.  
> She was feeling better, about everthing.  Even though Lunarpine had 
> not taught her to fight, he taught her something about herself.  
She 
> smiled at the thought.  She watched the sunset with a new attitude 
> and better train of thought. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Lunarpine knew the question would be asked sooner or later, he 
just 
> > wanted to hear her ask. "I don't know if I can, you seem 
distracted 
> > with me around." He wasn't entirely serious but she needed to be 
> kept 
> > in place. Lunarpine sensed her feelings toward him, those would 
> have 
> > to be tossed aside before she could take him seriously."You can't 
> be 
> > taught, you already have everything you need, you just need to 
> > download it from inside yourself." The wolf in him knew he 
couldn't 
> > teach her to fly, but he'd be slaged before he saw her quit on 
> > herself.
> > 
> > "The great leaders didn't get taught to be great, the great 
> fighters 
> > weren't taught to fight, either it's there or it's not. I can't 
see 
> > your spark, so tell me, what are you, a lover, a fighter, a 
leader, 
> a 
> > follwer? WHAT ARE YOU?"
> > 
> > That was the one question she had to overcome before she could 
> reach 
> > her full potential.
